rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A human language that is or was designed by a person.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Conlang

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a constructed language to a person or the person who created the language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Created by

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a constructed language to the date that the language was created.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date Created

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors to classify constructed languages, e.g. fictional language, philosophical language or musical language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Conlang Purpose

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a standard descriptor for a kind of constructed language to a language that is an example of this kind, e.g. it links 'fictional language' to 'Na'vi'.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Languages of this Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing people who have created constructed languages, e.g. L. L. Zamenhof created Esperanto.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language Creator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a language creator to a language that he or she created.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Languages Created

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A form of a human language that is used by a particular region or social group, e.g. Australian English is a dialect of English.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language Dialect

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a dialect to the language of which it is a dialect.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all language expressions. These are the groupings of words that create a meaning, like idioms, maxims, adages, and so forth.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Expression

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.expression to the mso:language.human_language that the expression belongs to.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.expression to the mso:language.words that make up the expression.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Words

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A group of languages that descend from a common ancestor, e.g. the romance languages, which all descend from Latin.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language Family

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.family to the mso:people.ethnicity that speak the languages as a group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ethnicity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a language family to a location where this language family has a significant presence.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Geographic Distribution

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: ISO 639-5 code is a 3-letter (latin alphabet) code designation for a language family or group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ISO 639-5 Code
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use mso:language.family.iso_639_coding instead, as this item will not be supported. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:language.family.iso_639_coding]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating an mso:language.family to the mso:language.iso_639_coding.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ISO Coding

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a language family to one of the languages in the family, e.g. the romance family of languages contains French, Spanish, and Italian, among others.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a language family to another language family, of which it is a member. For example, it relates the Germanic languages to the Indo-European languages.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Member of Language Families

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a language family to another language family, of which it is a parent. For example, it relates Indo-European languages to the Germanic languages.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Sub-families

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all glyphs. Glyphs are the variants of an abstract unit, mso:language.grapheme.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Glyph

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.glyph to the mso:language.grapheme, of which the glyph is a variant.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Grapheme

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all graphemes. These are the most basic units of language, the alphabetic letters, logograms, numerals, and punctuation of a language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Grapheme

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.grapheme to the mso:language.writing_system that uses the grapheme.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Writing System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A system of human communication consisting of sounds and/or characters, words, phrases, and sentences. Note that a human language can be natural or constructed ('conlang'). Note too that this type is used exclusively for members of the lowest-level language family. For example, the Kapampangan language belongs to the hierarchy of language families Central Luzon (lowest level) -> Northern Philippine -> Philippine -> Malayo-Polynesian -> Austronesian (highest level).
Things that are a human language: ## Living languages or modern languages (e.g. French language, English language, Standard Mandarin, German language).
## Mixed languages that are a fusion of source languages (e.g. Michif language, Mednyj Aleut, Cappadocian Greek language).
## Creole languages (e.g. Nubi language, Fa d'Ambu language Guianese Creole French language).
## Extinct languages (e.g. Ceylon Dutch language, Chemakum, Cotoname language, Weyto language).
## Reconstructed languages (e.g. Proto-Germanic language, Proto-Celtic language, Proto-Kra language)
## Planned and constructed languages (e.g. Esperanto language, Volap??k, Loglan, Afrihili).
## Fictional languages that became working languages or are being developed into working languages (e.g. Klingon language, Mandalorian language, Quenya, Lapine). In these cases the type mso:fictional_universe.language should also be used.
## Sign languages (e.g. American Sign Language, Martha???s Vineyard Sign Language, Providencia Sign Language, Al-Sayyid Bedouin Sign Language).
Things that are Not a Human Language:
## Dialects (e.g. Welsh English, Canadian French, Gyeongsang dialect, Negombo Tamil). In these cases, use mso:language.dialect. Note, though, that, if it is unclear whether something is a language or a dialect, both mso:language.human_language and mso:language.dialect can be used.
## Forms of a language that involve code-switching or borrowings from another language, but which have not become true mixed languages or creoles (e.g. Spanglish, Portunol, Franglais, Taglish)
## Fictional languages that are not working languages and are not being developed into working languages (e.g. Mangani, Marain, Huttanese language). In these cases use mso:fictional_universe.language.
## Writing systems (e.g. Tamil Brahmi, Rongorongo, Linear Elamite, Inuktitut Syllabics). In these cases use mso:language.writing_system.
## Language families (e.g. the Celtic languages family, the Bantu languages family). In these cases use mso:language.family.
## Ethnicity (e.g. Kurdish people, Maori, Sami). In these cases use mso:people.ethnicity.
## Programming languages (e.g. PHP, Perl, Simula). In these cases use mso:computer.programming_language.
## Animal languages (e.g. whale song, bird song, great ape language)
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Human Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a human language to a country in which the language is predominantly spoken.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Spoken in Countries

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a human language to the Windows code or codes associated with the given language, e.g. zh-hand, en-us or de.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Culture Code

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a human language to a dialect of the language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dialect

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a human language to the two-letter code for the language in the 639-1 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ISO 639-1 Code

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a human language to the three-letter code for the language in the 639-2 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ISO 639-2 Code

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a human language to the three-letter code for the language in the 639-3 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ISO 639-3 Code

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a human language to the group of languages from which the language descended.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language Family

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a human language to a country in which the language has an official status.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Main Country

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a human language to a location where the language is spoken. Note that language.human_language.country or language.human_language.main_country should be used for countries that speak the language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Region

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a human language to the code of the language in the Rosetta Project, an effort to survey and archive 1,500 languages.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rosetta Project Code

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a human language to a writing system employed by the language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Writing System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type collecting information about the coding of a language or language family by the classification set 639 of the International Organization for Standardization.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ISO 639 Coding

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.iso_639_coding to the code for the language or language family.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Code

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.iso_639_coding to the mso:language.family for which the code applies.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Family

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.iso_639_coding to the relevant part of the standard. Note that there are six parts to the ISO 639 standard.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Standard Part

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.iso_639_coding to the year for which the ISO standard is valid.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Year

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the level at which a human language is spoken.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language Competency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the human language that is spoken.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the level at which the given human language is spoken.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Proficiency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration type that contains standard values for the levels of knowledge of a human language, viz. elementary proficiency, limited working proficiency, general professional proficiency, advanced professional proficiency, and functionally native proficiency.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language Proficiency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration value that indicates the fourth of five levels of language proficiency.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Advanced Professional Proficiency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration value that indicates the first of five levels of language proficiency.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Elementary Proficiency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration value that indicates the fifth of five levels of language proficiency.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Functionally Native Proficiency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration value that indicates the third of five levels of language proficiency.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: General Professional Proficiency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration value that indicates the second of five levels of language proficiency.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Limited Working Proficiency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A meaning associated with a given linguistic unit, e.g. the meaning of bachelor is: unmarried, adult, male human.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Linguistic Meaning

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a linguistic meaning to a linguistic unit that expresses the meaning.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Linguistic Unit

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a linguistic meaning to a meaning that is more specific. For example, many dictionaries will separate broad senses of a word or phrase using numbers, e.g. 1, 2, 3, ... These broad senses will then be separated using letters, e.g. 1a, 1b, 2a, 2b, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Submeaning

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of types of language units, including words, syllables, names, and morphemes. These are the units of language that messages can be analyzed into.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Linguistic Unit

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.linguistic_unit to its alternate spellings.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Alternate Spelling

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a linguistic item to another linguistic item whose meaning is contrary or opposed to the meaning of the first linguistic item, e.g. "happy" is an antonym of "sad".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Antonym

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.linguistic_unit to an mso:language.linguistic_unit that is broader in meaning.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Broader

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.linguistic_unit to its authorized, official or accepted spelling.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Canonical Spelling

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.linguistic_unit to its mso:language.human_language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a linguistic item to a meaning associated with the linguistic item.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Meaning

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a linguistic unit to its etymology, i.e. how the word or phrase was derived from words or phrases of the same language or a different language. For example, the origin of the word "vivacious" is the Latin word "vivax" (genitive form: "vivacis").
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Origin

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.linguistic_unit to its originating mso:language.human_language. For example, the originating language for the name 'Vasilisa' is Russian, and the originating language for the word 'plonk' is the British English.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Origin Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.linguistic_unit to its region of origin. For example, the name 'Vasilisa' is from the location Russia, and the origin region for the word 'plonk' is Britan.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Origin Region

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a linguistic unit to its part of speech, i.e. the role that the linguistic unit plays in its language, e.g. noun, adjective, verb, adverb, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Part of Speech

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.linguistic_unit to its phonetic pronunciation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pronunciation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a linguistic unit to a URI of an audio file which provides the correct pronunciation of the given linguistic unit.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Audio Pronunciation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a linguistic item to another linguistic item whose meaning is the same as that of the first linguistic item, e.g. "thankfulness" and "gratitude" are synonyms in English.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Synonym

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity type representing the collection of modeling languages. These include computer-based modeling languages, like those that are domain-specific, and modeling languages used in project management and systems engineering.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Modeling Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all morphemes. Morphemes are the smallest linguistic units of a language with meaning, these units cannot be subdivided into component parts.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Morpheme

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.morpheme to its mso:language.morpheme_type.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Morpheme Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all morpheme types. These are the broad groupings of morphemes, like 'bound morpheme', and 'suffix'.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Morpheme Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all multiple sequences of letters that behave as a unit. An example is the combination of 's' and 'h' in the multigraph 'sh' in English.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Multigraph

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.multigraph to the mso:language.graphemes that make up the multigraph.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Component Grapheme

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.multigraph to its mso:language.multigraph_type.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Multigraph Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.multigraph to a mso:language.phoneme_usage which the multigraph represents.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Phoneme Usage

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.multigraph to the mso:language.writing_system in which it is used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Writing System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all multigraph types. These are the groupings of multigraphs like 'digraph' and 'octagraph'.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Multigraph Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all names. These are the units of language by which an individual is known. Subsets of this collection include given names and last names.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Name

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:langage.name to the mso:people.gender associated with the name.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Gender

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:langage.name to the mso:langage.name(s) that are considered nicknames of the given name.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Nickname

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:langage.name to other related langage.names.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Related Name

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.name to its variations. For example, 'Damon' and 'Damien' are variations of each other.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Variation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The role that the linguistic item plays in its language, e.g. noun, adjective, verb, adverb, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Part of Speech

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all phonemes. Phonemes are the basic units of sound for a language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Phoneme

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Relationship collecting the data on the usage of a particular phoneme in a given language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Phoneme Usage

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.phoneme_usage to the mso:language.human_language in which it is used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.phoneme_usage to the mso:language.phoneme that is used in the given language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Phoneme

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A phrase is a collection of words in a given language that have a single function within a sentence, e.g. a noun phrase or verb phrase.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Phrase

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a phrase to one of the words in the phrase.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Word

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An organization that provides prescriptions about how a particular language should and should not be used, e.g. the Accademia della Crusca provides guidance about how the Italian language should be used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language Regulator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a language regulator to the language that the organization regulates.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The collection of all instances of a linguistic unit. For example, in a particular newspaper article, the word "president" might occur 8 times, and each of these occurrences of the word is a separate token.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Token

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a linguistic token to the entity that is referred to by the token.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Referenced Entity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a token to the block of text where the token appears.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Referring Text

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a linguistic token to an integer indicating the position where the token ends in the given block of text.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Text End Index

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a linguistic token to an integer indicating the position where the token begins in the given block of text.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Text Start Index

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all words. Words are the stand-alone linguistic units of a language with semantic meaning.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Word

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:language.word to its component mso:language.morpheme
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Morpheme

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A method that uses printed symbols to transfer and store messages of a given language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language Writing System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a writing system to another writing system that is descended from it.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Child Writing Systems

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a writing system to the sequence of four letters assigned by the ISO 15924 standard to the writing system.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ISO 15924 Alpha
ISO 15924 code
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: This property is not necessary. Use either language.writing_system.iso_15924_alpha or language.writing_system.iso_15924_numeric. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:language.writing_system.iso_15924_alpha]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a writing system to the sequence of numbers assigned by the ISO 15924 standard to the writing system.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: ISO 15924 Numeric

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a writing system to a language that uses the writing system.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Languages

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a writing system to another writing system from which it is derived.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Parent Writing Systems

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a writing system to a standard descriptor to classify kinds of writing systems, e.g. alphabet, ideogram, and pictogram.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Type of Writing

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a writing system to the date that the writing system was first used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Used from

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a writing system to the date that the writing system was last used, if the writing system is no longer extant.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Used until

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors to classify kinds of writing systems, e.g. alphabet, ideogram, and pictogram.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language Writing Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a standard descriptor for a kind of writing system to a particular writing system that is an example of the kind.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Writing Systems
